episode_title: 121 - The One With The Fake Monica

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is looking at papers.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How could someone get a hold of your credit card number?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I have no idea. But look how much they spent!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, would you calm down? The credit card people said that you only have to pay for the stuff that you bought.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know. It’s just such reckless spending.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think when someone steals your credit card, they’ve kind of already thrown caution to the wind.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow, what a geek. They spent $69.95 on a Wonder Mop.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! The yuk! Ross, he’s doing it again! (Points to a lamp which is shaking behind the sofa)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel, stop humping the lamp! Stop humping! Now Marcel, come back- (Marcel runs toward Rachel’s room) come here, Marcel-

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, not in my room! I’ll get him.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, you’ve got to do something about the humping.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? It’s, it’s just a phase.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, that’s what we said about Joey…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Would you all relax? It’s not that big a deal.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Stop it! Marcel! Bad monkey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let’s just say my Curious George doll is no longer curious.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, late at night Monica is still examining her bill as Rachel emerges from her room.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Monica. You are not still going over that thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This woman’s living my life.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s living my life, and she’s doing it better than me! Look at this, look. She buys tickets for plays that I wanna see. She, she buys clothes from stores that I’m intimidated by the sales people. She spent three hundred dollars on art supplies.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re not an artist.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, well I might be if I had the supplies! I mean, I could do all this stuff. Only I don’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Monica, c’mon, you do cool things.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh really? Okay, let’s compare, shall we.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, it’s so late for ’shall we’…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do I go horseback riding in the park? Do I take classes at the New School?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nooo…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is so unfair! She’s got everything I want, and she doesn’t have my mother.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are discussing stage names.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How about Joey… Pepponi?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, still too ethnic. My agent thinks I should have a name that’s more neutral.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joey… Switzerland?
(The waitress brings their coffee.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Plus, y’know, I think it should be Joe. Y’know, Joey makes me sound like I’m, I dunno, this big. (Waitress looks at him funny) Which I’m not.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Joe…Joe…Joe…Stalin?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Stalin…Stalin…do I know that name? It sounds familiar.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, it does not ring a bell with me…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joe Stalin. Y’know, that’s pretty good.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Might wanna try Joseph.
(Joey visibly thinks ‘Of course!’ and writes it down.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joseph Stalin. I think you’d remember that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yes! Bye Bye Birdie, starring Joseph Stalin. Joseph Stalin is the Fiddler on the Roof.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is there as Phoebe and Rachel enter.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi. (On the phone) Hi, uh, yes, this is Monica Geller. Um, I believe I’m taking some classes with you and I was wondering what they were.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, great. Thanks a lot. (Hangs up) I’m going to tap class.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, what, so that you can dance with the woman that stole your credit card?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This woman’s got my life, I should get to see who she is.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Go to the post office! I’m sure her picture’s up! …Okay, Monica, y’know what, honey, you’re kinda losing it here! I mean, this is really becoming like a weird obsession thing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is madness. It’s madness, I tell you, for the love of God, Monica, don’t do it !! …Thank you.

content.description: A Tap Class, the girls are standing at the door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What d’you think?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Lotsa things.
(They go in and sit down.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Which one do you think she is?
(The teacher comes up to them.)

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: May I help you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, no thanks, we’re just here to observe.

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: You don’t observe a dance class. You dance a dance class. Spare shoes are over there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What does she mean?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think she means (Imitates) ‘You dance a dance class’. Oh, c’mon, c’mon. (They put on some spare shoes)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, d’y’see anybody you think could be me?

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: People! Last time there were some empty yoghurt containers lying around after class. Let’s not have that happen again!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She could be you.
(Music starts)

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: Let’s get started. Five, six, a-five six seven eight…
(Everyone starts to dance in unison. Monica flounders)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, I’m not getting this!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m totally getting it!
content.parenthetical: Dancing in a swirly, Phoebe kind of way

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you ever feel like sometimes you are just so unbelievably uncoordinated?
(Rachel taps into view; she is in perfect sync with the rest of the class)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? You just click when they click.

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: Alright people, now everyone grab a partner.
(The girls are unsure how to pair off. Phoebe settles it)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. And, my, dead, mother, says, you, are, it. I’m with Rachel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Great. It’s gym class all over again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aww.

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: Well that’s all right, you can come up to the front and dance with me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t I just take off my clothes and have a nightmare.
(She starts to walk very slowly toward the front of the room. The teacher grabs her hand and pulls her. Suddenly a woman bursts in)

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: It’s okay, it’s okay, I’m here, I’m here. Sorry I’m late, okay, here I am. Who’s the new tense girl?

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: She’s your partner.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi. I’m Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. Monica! …Hi. I’m Mo- …nana.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Monana?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. It’s Dutch.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: You’re kidding! I-I spent three years in Amsterdam. (Asks her something in Dutch)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um, Pennsylvania Dutch.

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: And we’re dancing. A-five, six, seven, eight…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Where’ve you been?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: At the vet.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She’s not gonna make you wear one of those big plastic cones, is she?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She says Marcel’s humping thing’s not a phase. Apparently he’s reached sexual maturity.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! He beat ya.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She says as time goes on, he’s gonna start getting agressive and violent.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what does this mean?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna have to give him up.

content.description: Central Perk, scene continued from earlier. They guys are sitting there like the Three Monkeys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe it, Ross. This sucks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t get it, I mean, you just got him. How can he be an adult already?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know. I know. I mean, one day, he’s this little thing, and before you know it, he’s this little thing I can’t get off my leg.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Isn’t there any way you can keep him?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no. The vet says unless he’s in a place where he has regular access to some… monkey lovin,’ he’s just gonna get vicious. I’ve just gotta get him into a zoo.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How do you get a monkey into a zoo?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know that one! …No, that’s Popes into a Volkswagen .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, we’re applying to a lot of them. Naturally our first choice would be one of the bigger state zoos, y’know, like, uh, San Diego… right? But that might just be a pipe dream, because, y’know, he’s out of state. Uh, my vet, uh, knows someone at Miami, so that’s a possibility.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, but that’s like two blocks away from the beach. I mean, it’s a total party zoo.
(Phoebe, Monica, and Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. We found her, we found the girl.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Did you call the cops?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nope. We took her to lunch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah. Your own brand of vigilante justice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?! Are you insane? This woman stole from you. She stole. She’s a stealer.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? After you’re with this woman for like ten minutes, you forget all that. I mean, she is this astounding person, with this, with this amazing spirit.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, which she probably stole from some cheerleader.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …Take off their hats!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Popes in a Volkswagen ! …I love that joke.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica, Rachel and Fake Monica are there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No way. No way did you do this.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Monana was very brave.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It was so wild. We told them we were the Gunnersens in room six fifteen. Only to find out the Boston Celtics had taken over the entire sixth floor!

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: So once they caught on to the fact that we’re, y’know, short and have breasts…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: …They threw us out! I was thrown out of a hotel! Me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Go Monana! Well, you ladies are not the only ones living the dream. I get to go pour coffee for people I don’t know. Don’t wait up. (Exits)

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Oh, by the way, tomorrow we’re auditioning for a Broadway show.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ’scuse me?

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: There’s an open call for Cats. I’m thinking we go down there, sing Memories and make complete fools of ourselves. Whaddya say?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nononononono. Think who you’re dealing with here. I mean, I’m not like you. I-I can’t even stand in front of a tap class.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Well, that’s just probably ’cause of your Amish background.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Well, you’re Pennsylvania Dutch, right?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Right. Till I bought a blow dryer, then I was shunned.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: I-I used to be just like you. And then one day I saw a movie that changed my life. Did you ever see Dead Poets’ Society ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: I thought that movie was so incredibly… boring . I mean, that thing at the end where the kid kills himself because he can’t be in the play? What was that?! It’s like, kid, wait a year, leave home, do some community theatre. I walked out of there and I thought, ‘Now, that’s two hours of my life that I’m never getting back.’ And that thought scared me more than all the other crap I was afraid to do.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow. Then I would definitely not recommend Mrs. Doubtfire .

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, tiem lapse. Everyone but Joey and Monica are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God. (To Marcel) We didn’t get into Scranton. (To the others) That was like our safety zoo. They take like dogs and cows. See? I don’t know who this is harder on, me or him.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’d say that chair’s taking the brunt.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel! Marcel! Marcel, no! Good boy. See, how can nobody want him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, somebody will.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know there already is a Joseph Stalin?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re kidding.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Apparently he was this Russian dictator who slaughtered all these people. You’d think you would’ve known that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, you’d think I would’ve.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Phoebe. Whaddyou think a good stage name for me would be?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: …Flame Boy.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is talking to Dr. Baldhara, a zookeeper.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Where exactly is your zoo?

content.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
content.text: Well, it’s technically not a zoo per se, it’s more of an interactive wildlife experience. Let me ask you some questions about, is it, uh, Marcel?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
content.text: Does he, uh, fight with other animals?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no, he’s, he’s very docile.

content.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
content.text: Even if he were… cornered?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I, I don’t know. Why?

content.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
content.text: Uh, how is he at handling small objects?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He can hold a banana, if that’s whatcha mean…

content.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
content.text: How about a hammer, or a small blade?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why- why- why would he need a blade?

content.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
content.text: Well, if he’s up against a jungle cat or an animal with horns, you’ve got to give the little guy something. Otherwise it’s just cruel.
(Chandler and Joey burst in, with Marcel)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He- he- he got in, he- he got in to San Diego.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We, we come back from our walk and the- the phone was ringing…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …He’s in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: He’s in! Oh, did you hear that, Marcel? San Diego. San Diego!

content.speaker: Dr. Baldhara
content.text: You’re making a big mistake here. I mean, San Diego’s all well and good, but if you give him to me, I’ll start him off against a blind rabbit and give you twenty percent of the gains.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is dusting. She comes to the table, lifts all the magazines and wipes under them, then just puts them down again. Monica bursts in, obviously drunk.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yo- hooo!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Where the hell’ve you been?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Monica and I just crashed an embassy party.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you drunk?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Noooo! (Comes closer and whispers) I’m lying. I am so drunk.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, oh. Great, Monica, y’know what, you could’ve called, I have been up here, I’ve been worried…
(Monica is drinking from the tap)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica? Monica!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Water rules!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, yes, it does. Okay, look, the restaurant called, they wanna know if you’re gonna be showing up for work?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nope. Going to the Big Apple Circus today.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay Monica, what are you doing? You’re gonna lose your job! This is not you!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, it is me! Y’know, I’m not just the person who needs to fluff the pillows and pay the bills as soon as they come in! Y’know, when I’m with her, I am so much more than that. I’m- I’m Monana!
(The phone rings and Rachel answers)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello? Yes, she is, hold on a second, please. Monana, it’s for you, the credit card people.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Helloooo? Yeah. Oh my God. Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They’ve arrested Monica.

content.description: New York City Department of Correction, Monica is visiting Fake Monica.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How are you?

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: I’m not too bad. Fortunately, blue’s my colour. How-how did you know I was here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because… I’m Monica Geller. It was my credit card you were using.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: That I was not expecting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I want you to know, it wasn’t me who turned you in.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Oh. Thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, thank you! You have given me so much! I mean, if it wasn’t for you, I would never have gotten to sing Memories on the stage at the Wintergarden Theater !

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Well, actually, you only got to sing ’memo-’.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I just can’t believe you’re in here. I mean, what am I gonna do without you? Who’s gonna crash the embassy parties with me? Who’s gonna take me to the Big Apple Circus ?

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Monica, I started my day by peeing in front of twenty-five other women, and you’re worried about who’s gonna take you to the Big Apple Circus ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, not… worried, just… wondering.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: There’s nothing to wonder about, Monica. You’re gonna go back to being exactly who you were, because that’s who you are.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not necessarily…

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Yes necessarily! I mean, I dunno what it is, maybe it’s the Amish thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um, I’m not actually Amish.

content.speaker: Fake Monica
content.text: Really? Then why are you like that?

content.description: Tap Class, Monica is standing by the door.

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: You by the door. In or out?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: In. (She joins in the dancing. She still flounders)

content.speaker: Teacher
content.text: You in the back, you’re getting it all wrong!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, but at least I’m doing it!

content.description: The Airport, everyone but Monica is there to see off Marcel.

content.speaker: PA
content.text: This is the final boarding call for flight 67 to San Diego, boarding at gate 42A.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Good-bye, little monkey guy. Alright, I wrote you this poem. Okay, but don’t eat it ’till you get on the plane.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Aww. Thank you, Aunt Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, bye, champ. Now, I know there’s gonna be a lot of babes in San Diego, but remember, there’s also a lot to learn.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I dunno what to say, Ross. Uh, it’s a monkey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just, just say what you feel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Marcel, I’m hungry.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That was good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Marcel, this is for you. It’s, uh, just, y’know, something to, um, do on the plane.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, if you guys don’t mind, I’d like to take a moment, just me and him.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, sure. Sure, absolutely. (They just stand there, then realise what he means and go to the other end of the room)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel, c’mere, c’mere. (He sits down and Marcel jumps down and sits beside him) Well buddy, this is it. There’s just a coupla things I want to say. I’m really gonna miss you, and I’m never gonna forget about you. You’ve been more than just a pet to me, you’ve been more like a be- (Marcel climbs down and starts humping his leg) Okay, Marcel, please, could you leave my leg alone? Could you just stop humping me for two seconds?! Marcel, would- okay, just take him away. Just take him.
(Marcel is put in a cage and taken away.)

content.description: A Theater, there is a casting session going on for a play.

content.speaker: Actor
content.text: Oh, that I were a glove upon that hand, that I might… touch thy cheek…

content.speaker: Casting Director No. 1
content.text: That’s fine, thank you.

content.speaker: Casting Director No. 2
content.text: Next. (Joey walks onstage)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi, uh, I’ll be reading for the role of Mercutio.

content.speaker: Casting Director No. 2
content.text: Name?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Holden McGroin.
